abstract: Research shows veterans with multiple tours of combat duty face different challenges than other soldiers do after returning home; while most soldiers grapple primarily with emotional trauma on return, elite subset, whose numbers now surpass 90,000, often must unlearn behaviors that allowed them to survive so well overseas; habits include unceasing vigilance and snap decision-making.
lead_paragraph: The number of veterans with multiple tours of combat duty is the largest in modern American history — more than 90,000 soldiers and Marines.

headline.main: Those With Multiple Tours of War Overseas Struggle at Home
headline.print_headline: After Thriving in Combat Tours, Veterans Are Struggling at Home

snippet: The number of veterans with multiple tours of combat duty is the largest in modern American history — more than 90,000 soldiers and Marines.

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
